00033 std::string aw::parameterContextToString(aw::ParameterContext pc)
00034 {
00035     std::string pcName;
00036     switch (pc) {     
00037         case aw::pContextNameNone:
00038             pcName += "none";
00039             break;
00040         case aw::pContextNameFrequency:
00041             pcName += "frequency";
00042             break;
00043         case aw::pContextNamePeriodSeconds:
00044             pcName += "seconds";
00045             break;
00046         case aw::pContextNamePeriodSamples:
00047             pcName += "samples";
00048             break;
00049         case aw::pContextNameTrigger:
00050             pcName += "trigger";
00051             break;
00052         case aw::pContextNamePitch:
00053             pcName += "pitch";
00054             break;
00055         case aw::pContextNameBeatsPerMinute:
00056             pcName += "bpm";
00057             break;
00058         default:
00059             throw std::out_of_range("parameterContextToString(): the given ParameterContext matches no known ParameterContext"); 
00060     };
00061 
00062     return pcName;
00063 }

00067 // pass a copy of the string, not a reference
00068 aw::ParameterContext aw::stringToParameterContext(std::string str)
00069 {
00070     // copy of a string is pased, not a reference, so can edit in place
00071     // remove extra space, lower case
00072     aw::scrubString(str);
00073     aw::ParameterContext pc; // an integer
00074 
00075     if (str == "none" || str == "") // an empty string is none
00076         pc = aw::pContextNameNone;
00077     else if (str == "frequency")
00078         pc = aw::pContextNameFrequency;
00079     else if (str == "periodseconds" || str == "seconds" || str == "sec")
00080         pc = aw::pContextNamePeriodSeconds;
00081     else if (str == "periodsamples" || str == "samples" || str == "samp")
00082         pc = aw::pContextNamePeriodSamples;
00083     else if (str == "trigger")
00084         pc = aw::pContextNameTrigger;
00085     else if (str == "pitch")
00086         pc = aw::pContextNamePitch;
00087     else if (str == "beatsperminute" || str == "bpm")
00088         pc = aw::pContextNameBeatsPerMinute;
00089     else
00090         throw std::out_of_range("stringToParameterContext(): the given string (" + str + ")  matches no known ParameterContext"); 
00091     return pc;
00092 }

00150 aw::ParameterName aw::stringToParameterName(std::string str)
00151 {
00152     // copy of a string is pased, not a reference, so can edit in place
00153     // remove extra space, lower case
00154     aw::scrubString(str);
00155     
00156     ParameterName pn; // an integer
00157 
00158     if (str == "minimum" || str == "min")
00159         pn = aw::pNameMinimum;
00160     else if (str == "maximum" || str == "max")
00161         pn = aw::pNameMaximum;
00162     else if (str == "refresh")
00163         pn = aw::pNameRefresh;
00164     else if (str == "rate")
00165         pn = aw::pNameRate;
00166     else if (str == "value")
00167         pn = aw::pNameValue;
00168     else if (str == "dutycycle")
00169         pn = aw::pNameDutyCycle;
00170     else if (str == "operand1" || str == "op1")
00171         pn = aw::pNameOperand1;
00172     else if (str == "operand2" || str == "op2")
00173         pn = aw::pNameOperand2;
00174     else if (str == "operand3" || str == "op3")
00175         pn = aw::pNameOperand3;
00176     else if (str == "operand4" || str == "op4")
00177         pn = aw::pNameOperand4;
00178     else if (str == "amplitude" || str == "amp")
00179         pn = aw::pNameAmplitude;
00180     else if (str == "valuelist")
00181         pn = aw::pNameValueList;
00182     else if (str == "selectionmethod")
00183         pn = aw::pNameSelectionMethod;
00184     else if (str == "panleftright" || str == "pan")
00185         pn = aw::pNamePanLeftRight;
00186 
00187     else
00188         throw std::out_of_range("stringToParameterName(): the given string (" + str + ") matches no known ParameterName"); 
00189     return pn;
00190 }

00236 // =============================================================================
00237 // unit interval transformations
00238 
00239 double aw::denorm(double value, double a, double b)
00240 {
00241     // need to handle value beyond 0 and 1
00242     if (value < 0 || value > 1) 
00243         throw std::out_of_range("value must be between 0 and 1"); 
00244 
00245     // if no range, return boundary
00246     if (a == b) return a;
00247     // general form: value * (max - min) + max;
00248     // a is min, b is max
00249     else if (a < b) return (value * (b - a)) + a;
00250     // b is min, a is max
00251     else return (value * (a - b)) + b;   
00252 }

00257 double aw::sampleTimeToSecondTime(aw::SampleTimeType sampleTime, int sr)
00258 {
00259     // given a number of samples into the future, determine how manuy 
00260     // seconds this takes
00261     // simply divide by sampling reate
00262     return static_cast<double>(sampleTime) / sr;
00263 }

00280 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00282 double aw::secondTimeToSampleTime(double secondTime, int sr)
00283 {
00284     // as this takes double second values, this must return doubles
00285     return secondTime * static_cast<double>(sr);
00286 }

00289 // =============================================================================
00291 double aw::randomUnit()
00292 {
00293     // this works but clearly does not seem to be the best way to do this
00294     // since these are static, however, it might be fine, as there is one
00295     // for all instances?
00296     static double const min = 0;
00297     static double const max = 1;
00298     static aw::BaseGenerator base(std::time(0));
00299     static aw::Distribution dist(min, max);
00300     static aw::Generator rng(base, dist);
00301     return rng();
00302 
00303 }

00306 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00308 // based on Koenig, p135
00309 aw::Int32Signed aw::randomRange(aw::Int32Signed a, aw::Int32Signed b)
00310 {
00311     // for now, assume that a is min and b is max
00312     aw::Int32Signed shift = 0 - a; // get negative offset
00313     // aw::Int32Signed min = a + shift; // starts at zero now
00314     aw::Int32Signed max = b + shift; 
00315 
00316     // integer division truncates
00317     if (max > RAND_MAX) 
00318         throw std::domain_error("max aw::randomRange argument is out of range");
00319 
00320     const aw::Int32Signed bucketSize = RAND_MAX / max;
00321     aw::Int32Signed r;
00322 
00323     do r = std::rand() / bucketSize;
00324     while (r >= max);
00325 
00326     return r - shift; // restore shift value
00327 }

00334 // remove leading and trailing spaces and make lower case
00335 // pass by reference; used as a proc routine before string comparisons
00336 void aw::scrubString(std::string& str)
00337 {
00338     boost::to_lower(str);
00339     boost::trim(str);
00340 }

00352 std::string aw::arrayDoubleToString(double* a, int size)
00353 {
00354     // first, convert array to vector string
00355     std::vector<std::string> tokens; // for storage of string conversion
00356 
00357 //     for (std::vector<double>::const_iterator iter = v.begin(); 
00358 //         iter != v.end(); 
00359 //         ++iter) {
00360 
00361     for (int i=0; i<size; i++) {
00362         std::stringstream out;
00363         out << a[i]; 
00364         tokens.push_back(out.str()); 
00365     }
00366 
00367     std::string out = boost::join(tokens, ",");
00368 
00369     return out;
00370     
00371 }

00377     double x;
00378     if (!(i >> x))
00379         throw std::domain_error("convertToDouble(\"" + str + "\")");

00383 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00384 std::vector<double> aw::stringToVectorDouble(const std::string& str) 
00385 {
00386     // split string by commas, do post scrubbing
00387     std::vector<std::string> pre = aw::splitString(str, ",", true);
00388     // for output
00389     std::vector<double> out;
00390 
00391     for (std::vector<std::string>::const_iterator iter = pre.begin(); 
00392         iter != pre.end(); 
00393         ++iter) {
00394         // could use string conversion with stringstream or similar
00395 //         std::stringstream out;
00396 //         out << *iter; 
00397         out.push_back(boost::lexical_cast<double>(*iter)); 
00398     };
00399     // can return vector; cannot return an array
00400     return out;
00401 }

00405 // need to check that all chars are either numbers or point values
00406 // TODO: this method is not complete: need better condition checking
00407 bool aw::canConvertFromStringToDouble(const std::string& str) {
00408     bool post; // if the are in the form value{3}
00409     double test;
00410 
00411     // if any comma delimiters are found, cannot use (a list likely)
00412     int foundDelimit = aw::countSubStrings(str, &aw::charListDelimit);
00413     if (foundDelimit > 0) return false;
00414 
00415     try {
00416         test = aw::stringToDouble(str);
00417         post = true;
00418     }
00419     catch (std::domain_error) {
00420         post = false;
00421     }
00422     return post;
00423 }

00451 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00452 std::vector<std::string> aw::splitString(const std::string& srcRaw, 
00453                                          const std::string& find, 
00454                                          bool postScrub) 
00455 {
00456     std::vector<std::string> out;
00457 
00458     // need to make a copy of src string, as must not be a const reference
00459     std::string src(srcRaw);
00460 
00461     for(StringSplitIterator it = boost::make_split_iterator(
00462             src, boost::first_finder(find, boost::is_iequal())); 
00463         it!=StringSplitIterator(); 
00464         ++it) { 
00465         std::string sub = boost::copy_range<std::string>(*it);
00466         // scrub string in place
00467         if (postScrub) aw::scrubString(sub); 
00468         out.push_back(sub);
00469     } 
00470     return out;
00471 }

00476 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00477 int aw::countSubStrings(const std::string& srcRaw, const std::string& find)
00478 {
00479     int count(0); 
00480 
00481     // need to make a copy of src string, as must not be a const reference
00482     std::string src(srcRaw);
00483 
00484     // make first finder that looks for find string, use this to 
00485     // to create a find iterator
00486     for(aw::StringFindIterator it=boost::make_find_iterator(
00487             src, boost::first_finder(find, boost::is_iequal())); 
00488         it != StringFindIterator(); 
00489         ++it) { 
00490         count++;
00491         } 
00492     return count;
00493 }

00496 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00497 bool aw::stringWellFormed(const std::string& str, const std::string& open, const std::string& close) 
00498 {
00499     int countOpen(0); 
00500     int countClose(0); 
00501     // see if open and close are the same
00502     countOpen = aw::countSubStrings(str, open);
00503     countClose = aw::countSubStrings(str, close);
00504     if (countOpen == countClose) return true;
00505     return false;
00506 }

00510 // =============================================================================
00511 
00513 void aw::getFirstParameterName(std::string& src, 
00514                                std::string& out,
00515                                std::string& working) {
00516     int openCount(0);
00517     int start(0);
00518     int end(0);
00519     int targetCount(0);
00520     bool writing(false);
00521 //     std::cout << src << ": out: " << out << " working: " << working << std::endl;    
00522     for(int i = 0; i < src.length(); i++) {
00523         if (src[i] == '{') openCount++;
00524         else if (src[i] == '}') openCount--;
00525         // if we are at open 0 level, writing has not started, and this is the
00526         // first 0 level found, start writing
00527         if (openCount == 0 && writing == false && targetCount == 0) {
00528             writing = true;
00529             start = i;
00530             targetCount++; // increment how many times at level 1
00531         }
00532         // as soon as open count move off of zero, stop writing; do not include
00533         // this point (its a brace)
00534         else if (openCount == 1 && writing == true)  {
00535             writing = false;
00536             end = i; // do not include this point
00537         }
00538         // if this is the last character of the source
00539         else if (openCount == 0 && writing == true && i == src.length()-1) {
00540             writing = false;
00541             end = i+1; // include last point
00542         }
00543 
00544 //         std::cout << src[i] << ": open: " << openCount << " writing: " << writing << std::endl;    
00545 
00546     }
00547 
00548 //     std::cout << "start, end " << start << " : " << end << std::endl;    
00549 
00550     // need source, start, and length to copy
00551     out.append(src, start, end-start);
00552     // assign to working everything after the removed section
00553     if (src.length()-end > 1) working.append(src, end, src.length()-end);
00554 
00555 }
00556 
00557 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00559 void aw::getFirstParameterArguments(std::string& src, 
00560                                     std::string& out, 
00561                                     std::string& working) {
00562     int openCount(0);
00563     int start(0);
00564     int end(0);
00565     int targetCount(0);
00566     bool writing(false);
00567 //     std::cout << src << ": out: " << out << " working: " << working << std::endl;    
00568     for(int i = 0; i < src.length(); i++) {
00569         if (src[i] == '{') openCount++;
00570         else if (src[i] == '}') openCount--;
00571         // if we are at open 0 level, writing has not started, and this is the
00572         // first 1 level found, start writing
00573         if (openCount == 1 && writing == false && targetCount == 0) {
00574             writing = true;
00575             start = i;
00576             targetCount++; // increment how many times at level 1
00577         }
00578         // when we next get open count to zero, the boundary has been closed
00579         // however, we need to include this point
00580         else if (openCount == 0 && writing == true) {
00581             writing = false;
00582             end = i+1; // want to include this point
00583         }
00584 //         std::cout << src[i] << ": open: " << openCount << " writing: " << writing << std::endl;    
00585     }
00586 
00587 //     std::cout << "start, end " << start << " : " << end << std::endl;    
00588 
00589     if (start != 0 && end != 0) { 
00590         // need source, start, and length to copy
00591         // need to remove outermost braces
00592         out.append(src, start+1, end-start-2);
00593         // assign to working everything after the removed section
00594         // working.append(src, 0, start);
00595         working.append(src, end, src.length()-end);
00596     }
00597     // if both start and end are zero, append all of of src to working
00598     else working.append(src); 
00599 
00600 //     if (src.length()-end > 1) working.append(src, end, src.length()-end);
00601 
00602 }
00603 
00604 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00606 // TODO: this may rely on there being no spaces between braces; need to scrub
00607 void aw::getFirstParameterContext(std::string& src, 
00608                                   std::string& out, 
00609                                   std::string& working) {
00610     int openCount(0);
00611     int start(0);
00612     int end(0);
00613     int targetCount(0);
00614     int openCountLast(0); // store last open count
00615     int openCountNext(-1); // store next open count
00616 
00617     int targetTransitions(0); // count transitions from 0 to 1
00618 
00619     bool writing(false);
00620 //     std::cout << src << ": out: " << out << " working: " << working << std::endl;    
00621     for(int i = 0; i < src.length(); i++) {
00622         if (src[i] == '{') openCount++;
00623         else if (src[i] == '}') openCount--;
00624 
00625         // count how many times we go from 0 to 1; can only accept 2nd
00626         if (openCountLast == 0 && openCount == 1) targetTransitions++;
00627         
00628         // look ahead one character; this assumes there are no spaces
00629         openCountNext = openCount; // assign to present
00630         if (i < src.length()-1) {
00631             if (src[i+1] == '{') openCountNext++;
00632             else if (src[i+1] == '}') openCountNext--;
00633         }
00634 
00635         // if we are at open 0 level for the second time moving from 1
00636         // then we have the context 
00637         // first 1 level found, start writing
00638         // next char is a level increase
00639         // this marks the close of the last group, so need to shift 1
00640         if (openCount == 0 && writing == false && openCountLast == 1 && openCountNext == 1 && targetTransitions == 1 && targetCount == 0) {
00641             writing = true;
00642             start = i+1;
00643             targetCount++; // increment how many times at level 1
00644 
00645         }
00646         // when we next get open count to zero, the boundary has been closed
00647         else if (openCount == 0 && writing == true) {
00648             writing = false;
00649             end = i+1; // want to include this point
00650         }
00651         openCountLast = openCount;
00652 
00653 //         std::cout << src[i] << ": open: " << openCount << " writing: " << writing << " targetTransitions: " << targetTransitions << std::endl;    
00654     }
00655     // only get if set
00656     if (start != 0 && end != 0) { 
00657         // need source, start, and length to copy
00658         // need to remove outermost braces
00659         out.append(src, start+1, end-start-2);
00660         // assign to working everything after the removed section
00661         // working.append(src, 0, start);
00662         working.append(src, end, src.length()-end);
00663     }
00664     else working.append(src); 
00665 
00666 }
00667 
00668 
00669 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00671 void aw::getFirstParameterTrio(std::string& src, // input
00672                                std::string& name, // output to write to
00673                                std::string& arguments,
00674                                std::string& context,
00675                                std::string& working) {
00676 
00677     // remove white space; TODO need to remove intermingled white space 
00678     //aw::scrubString(src);
00679 
00680     std::string workingPostName; 
00681     std::string workingPostArguments; 
00682     std::string workingPostContext; 
00683 
00684     aw::getFirstParameterName(src, name, workingPostName);
00685     aw::getFirstParameterArguments(src, arguments, workingPostArguments);
00686     aw::getFirstParameterContext(src, context, workingPostContext);
00687     
00688     // if no context, and no parameters, return name working
00689     if (name != "" && arguments == "" && context == "") {
00690         working = workingPostName;
00691         //std::cout << "getFirstParameterTrio: setting working from working post name " << std::endl;
00692     }
00693     // if not context, assign working after parameters
00694     else if (context == "") {
00695         working = workingPostArguments;
00696         //std::cout << "getFirstParameterTrio: setting working from working post arguments " << std::endl;
00697     }
00698     else if (context != "") {
00699         working = workingPostContext;
00700         //std::cout << "getFirstParameterTrio: setting working from working post context " << std::endl;
00701     }
00702 }
00703 
00704 
00705 
00706 
00707 // =============================================================================

00710 
00711 void aw::printDebug(std::string& str)
00712 {
00713     std::cout << "aw_Common::printDebug(): " << str << std::endl;
00714 }
00715 
00716 void aw::printDebug(double v)
00717 {
00718     std::cout << "aw_Common::printDebug(): " << numberToString(v) << std::endl;
00719 }

00724 // =============================================================================
00726 // we must provide a length argument
00727 void aw::printArray (double arg[], aw::Int32Signed length, const std::string& header) 
00728 {
00729     std::vector<std::string> tokens; // for storage of string conversion
00730 
00731     // convert to a vector of strings
00732     for (aw::Int32Signed i=0; i<length; i++) {
00733         std::stringstream out;
00734         out << arg[i]; // adds to stream
00735         tokens.push_back(out.str()); 
00736     };
00737 
00738     // using boost::join, returns a string
00739     // return boost::join(tokens, " | ");
00740     std::cout << header << ": " << boost::join(tokens, " | ") << std::endl;
00741 }
00742 
00743 
00745 template <typename T>
00746 void aw::printVector (const std::vector<T>& src, const std::string& header) 
00747 {
00748     std::vector<std::string> tokens; // for storage of string conversion
00749     typedef typename std::vector<T>::const_iterator IterType;
00750 
00751     // use a const_iterator to get values out of src
00752     // go from .begin to .end
00753     for (IterType iter = src.begin(); iter != src.end(); ++iter) {
00754         std::stringstream out;
00755         // w/o iterator, would be src[i]
00756         // if access a member of structure named 'name', would use (*iter).name
00757         // parens are req due to precedence of .
00758         // this is the same as iter->name
00759         out << *iter; 
00760         tokens.push_back(out.str()); 
00761     };
00762     // using boost::join, returns a string
00763     std::cout << header << ": " << boost::join(tokens, " | ") << std::endl;
00764 }
00765 // these are required for each class of the tempalte
00766 // necessary b/c of template definition in header: http://www.parashift.com/c++-faq-lite/templates.html#faq-35.13
00767 // solve linking errors by providing samples
00768 template void aw::printVector<int> (const std::vector<int>& src, const std::string& header);
00769 //template void aw::printVector<aw::Int32Signed> (const std::vector<aw::Int32Signed>& src, const std::string& header);
00770 template void aw::printVector<double> (const std::vector<double>& src, const std::string& header);
00771 
00772 
00773
